items.title: Statue of Liberty
items.description: A colossal neoclassical sculpture on Liberty Island in New York Harbor

items.title: Eiffel Tower
items.description: A wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France

items.title: Great Wall of China
items.description: A series of fortifications that were built across the historical northern borders of ancient Chinese states

items.title: Pyramids of Giza
items.description: The pyramids are the last of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World

items.title: Stonehenge
items.description: A prehistoric monument in Wiltshire, England

items.title: Mount Rushmore
items.description: A sculpture carved into the granite face of Mount Rushmore in South Dakota, USA

items.title: Machu Picchu
items.description: An Incan citadel set high in the Andes Mountains in Peru

items.title: Colosseum
items.description: A large amphitheatre built in Rome under the Flavian emperors

items.title: Sydney Opera House
items.description: A multi-venue performing arts centre at Sydney Harbour in Sydney, Australia

items.title: Taj Mahal
items.description: An ivory-white marble mausoleum on the right bank of the Yamuna river in Agra, India

items.title: Angkor Wat
items.description: A temple complex in Cambodia, the largest religious monument in the world

items.title: Niagara Falls
items.description: Three waterfalls located at the southern end of Niagara Gorge, spanning the border between the province of Ontario in Canada and the state of New York in the United States

items.title: The Louvre
items.description: The world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris, France

items.title: Grand Canyon
items.description: A steep-sided canyon carved by the Colorado River in Arizona

items.title: Petra
items.description: An ancient city in Jordan known for its rock-cut architecture

items.title: Sagrada Familia
items.description: A large unfinished Roman Catholic basilica in Barcelona, Spain

items.title: Acropolis of Athens
items.description: An ancient citadel located on a rocky outcrop above the city of Athens, Greece

items.title: Chichen Itza
items.description: A large pre-Columbian city built by the Maya people in Mexico

items.title: Great Barrier Reef
items.description: The world's largest coral reef system off the coast of Australia

items.title: Mount Everest
items.description: The highest mountain in the world, located in the Himalayas

items.title: Golden Gate Bridge
items.description: A suspension bridge spanning the Golden Gate Strait, the entrance to the San Francisco Bay from the Pacific Ocean

items.title: Moai Statues
items.description: Monolithic human figures carved by the Rapa Nui people on Easter Island in eastern Polynesia

items.title: Christ the Redeemer
items.description: An Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

items.title: The Pantheon
items.description: A former Roman temple, now a Catholic church, in Rome, Italy

items.title: Yellowstone National Park
items.description: The first national park in the U.S. and is widely held to be the first national park in the world

items.title: Big Ben
items.description: The nickname for the Great Bell of the clock at the north end of the Palace of Westminster in London

items.title: Galapagos Islands
items.description: An archipelago of volcanic islands distributed on either side of the equator in the Pacific Ocean

items.title: Aurora Borealis
items.description: A natural light display in the Earth's sky, predominantly seen in the high-latitude regions

items.title: The Colossus of Rhodes
items.description: One of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. It was a statue of the Greek sun-god Helios, erected in the city of Rhodes

items.title: Tower of Pisa
items.description: A freestanding bell tower, known worldwide for its nearly four-degree lean

items.title: Versailles Palace
items.description: A royal ch√¢teau in Versailles, known for its Hall of Mirrors and beautiful gardens

items.title: Victoria Falls
items.description: A waterfall in southern Africa on the Zambezi River at the border between Zambia and Zimbabwe

items.title: The Great Sphinx
items.description: A limestone statue of a reclining sphinx, a mythical creature with the body of a lion and the head of a human

items.title: Potala Palace
items.description: The former residence of the Dalai Lama in Lhasa, Tibet. A symbol of Tibetan Buddhism

items.title: Uffizi Gallery
items.description: An art museum in Florence, Italy, one of the oldest and most famous art museums in the world

items.title: Uluru
items.description: Also known as Ayers Rock, a large sandstone rock formation in the southern part of the Northern Territory in Australia

items.title: St. Peter's Basilica
items.description: An Italian Renaissance church in Vatican City, the papal enclave within the city of Rome

items.title: Sistine Chapel
items.description: A chapel in the Apostolic Palace, the official residence of the pope, in Vatican City

items.title: The Dead Sea
items.description: A salt lake bordered by Jordan to the east and Israel and Palestine to the west

items.title: Kilimanjaro
items.description: A dormant volcano in Tanzania. It has three volcanic cones: Kibo, Mawenzi, and Shira

items.title: Hagia Sophia
items.description: A former Greek Orthodox Christian patriarchal basilica, later an Ottoman imperial mosque and now a museum in Istanbul, Turkey

items.title: The Parthenon
items.description: A former temple on the Athenian Acropolis, Greece, dedicated to the goddess Athena

items.title: The Kremlin
items.description: A fortified complex in the center of Moscow, the government headquarters of Russia

items.title: Serengeti National Park
items.description: A Tanzanian national park in the Serengeti ecosystem in the Mara and Simiyu regions

items.title: Ngorongoro Crater
items.description: A large volcanic caldera within the Ngorongoro Conservation Area in northern Tanzania

items.title: The Amazon Rainforest
items.description: A moist broadleaf tropical rainforest in the Amazon biome that covers most of the Amazon basin of South America

items.title: The Sahara Desert
items.description: The largest hot desert and the third largest desert overall after Antarctica and the Arctic

items.title: The Ganges River
items.description: The most sacred river to Hindus. It is also a lifeline to millions of Indians who live along its course and depend on it for their daily needs

items.title: Great Ocean Road
items.description: An Australian National Heritage listed 243-kilometre (151 mi) stretch of road along the south-eastern coast of Australia

items.title: The Matterhorn
items.description: A mountain of the Alps, straddling the main watershed and border between Switzerland and Italy
